1.name: SPARC Methodology
1.summary: Systematic development with orchestration integration (Native to Claude Flow)
1.details: 5-phase methodology (Specification â†’ Pseudocode â†’ Architecture â†’ Refinement â†’ Completion) with 17 specialized modes, quality gates, and topology integration. Enables structured workflows from requirements to deployment.
1.integration: Works with all 4 topologies, integrates with skills and custom commands
1.whyImpressive: Systematic quality enforcement with seamless orchestration integration. Handles complex projects with 10+ agents across 5 phases.

2.name: Orchestration Topology Integration
2.details: Mesh (peer-to-peer), Hierarchical (tree), Star (centralized), Ring (circular) topologies that integrate directly with SPARC methodology, skills, and custom workflows. Optimal coordination for different use cases.
2.performance: Optimal agent coordination, scalable to 10+ agents
2.integration: SPARC uses topologies, skills request topologies, custom commands combine topologies
2.whyImpressive: Four distinct coordination patterns that integrate directly with workflows, enabling optimal agent coordination for different use cases.

3.name: ReasoningBank Learning
3.summary: Adaptive learning from experience (Native to Claude Flow)
3.details: Stores successful patterns and automatically applies optimized strategies. Pattern recognition, strategy optimization, continuous learning, meta-learning.
3.integration: Learns from SPARC workflows, optimizes topologies, improves skill composition
3.whyImpressive: Adaptive learning system that stores successful patterns and automatically applies optimized strategies in future sessions.

4.name: Hive-Mind Coordination
4.summary: Advanced swarm patterns with consensus (Native to Claude Flow)
4.details: Queen-led collective intelligence, consensus mechanisms (Byzantine, Raft), and adaptive swarm behavior.
4.integration: Integrates with topologies for advanced coordination strategies
4.whyImpressive: Advanced swarm intelligence patterns that enable robust decision making and consensus in distributed agent systems.

5.name: Session Management System
5.details: Isolated workspaces for AI-generated content with HITL approval for promotion. File routing enforcement, lifecycle management, curated promotion.
5.performance: Clean workspace organization, scalable to high-volume generation
5.integration: All agents use sessions, SPARC organizes by session, skills generate in sessions
5.whyImpressive: Containment-promotion architecture that isolates AI-generated content, enabling clean workspace organization and curated promotion.

6.name: Tour Guide & Tutor Mode
6.details: Adaptive learning paths, interactive exercises, and workspace orientation tailored to proficiency levels.
6.integration: Uses meta-skill for discovery, memory for tracking progress

7.name: Captain's Log & Findings
7.summary: Decision journaling and issue tracking (Custom Protocol)
7.details: Human-readable journal for decisions, insights, and blockers. Automated findings tracking and pattern recognition.

8.name: Custom Command Engine
8.summary: Combine any skills into powerful workflows (Native Capability)
8.details: Create custom commands that combine multiple skills, pass data between skills, branch conditionally, and save reusable workflow templates. Enables powerful multi-phase workflows.
8.integration: Uses meta-skill, stream-chain, SPARC, topologies, memory
8.whyImpressive: Powerful composition capability that combines any skills into reusable workflows, enabling complex multi-phase operations.

9.name: Skill Integration Framework
9.details: The underlying framework that allows skills (Stock or Custom) to integrate via natural language discovery and data flow.
9.whyImpressive: The architectural backbone that allows disparate skills to function as a cohesive system through natural language and data flow.

10.name: Prompting Flexibility
10.summary: Open vs structured prompting spectrum (Native Capability)
10.details: Seamless transition between natural language (exploration) and structured commands (execution). Adapts to Flow modes.
Works with all skills and commands
Seamless transition between creative exploration and precise execution, adapting to user needs and workflow context.

stockVsCustom.philosophy: Leverage the powerful stock engine for execution, add thin custom layers for organization and specific domains.

integrationExamples.sparcTopology: SPARC methodology integrates with all 4 topologies (mesh, hierarchical, star, ring)
integrationExamples.skillComposition: Meta-skill routes to skills, stream-chain sequences them, custom commands combine them
integrationExamples.memoryCoordination: SPARC uses memory for phase transitions, topologies coordinate via memory, skills store patterns
integrationExamples.sessionIntegration: All agents use sessions, SPARC organizes by session, skills generate in sessions
